question.body: If the radius of a blood vessel lumen doubles, what happens to the resistance of the blood vessel?

multiple_choice.choice: resistance increases by a factor of 2 (i.e. it doubles)
resistance decreases by a factor of 2 (i.e. it becomes half of what it was)
resistance increases by a factor of 16
resistance decreases by a factor of 16

response.feedback: Incorrect. When the radius of the lumen increases, resistance does not increase.
Incorrect. Although it does decrease, it is a much larger effect.
Incorrect. When the radius of the lumen increases, resistance does not increase.
Correct. Resistance changes are inversely proportional to the fourth power of the radius. A doubling of the radius decreases resistance significantly.

part.hint: Consider the effect of a larger blood vessel radius on resistance.
